Package com.zoubworld.java.utils.compress.file

Interface IBinaryWriter

All Known Implementing Classes:
BinaryFinFout, BinaryPipeAlgo, BinaryStdOut
public interface IBinaryWriter
Author:
Pierre Valleau This interface is used to support write of any basic type of data on a storage object/file. byte, char,short,int, long string, float,double,Icode,Isymbol,n bits.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    void close()
    Flushes and closes standard output.
    void flush()
    Flushes standard output, padding 0s if number of bits written so far is not a multiple of 8.

    Writes the specified bit to standard output.

    Writes the 8-bit byte to standard output.

    Writes the 8-bit char to standard output.

    Writes the r-bit char to standard output.

  • Method Details

    • flush

      void flush()
      Flushes standard output, padding 0s if number of bits written so far is not a multiple of 8.

    • close

      void close()
      Flushes and closes standard output. Once standard output is closed, you can no longer write bits to it.

    • write

      void write​(boolean x)
      Writes the specified bit to standard output.
      Parameters:
      x - the boolean to write.

    • write

      void write​(byte x)
      Writes the 8-bit byte to standard output.
      Parameters:
      x - the byte to write.

    • write

      void write​(int x)
      Writes the 32-bit int to standard output.
      Parameters:
      x - the int to write.

    • write

      void write​(int x, int r)
      Writes the r-bit int to standard output.
      Parameters:
      x - the int to write.
      r - the number of relevant bits in the char.
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if r is not between 1 and 32.
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if x is not between 0 and 2r - 1.

    • write

      void write​(long x, int r)

    • write

      void write​(double x)
      Writes the 64-bit double to standard output.
      Parameters:
      x - the double to write.

    • write

      void write​(long x)
      Writes the 64-bit long to standard output.
      Parameters:
      x - the long to write.

    • write

      void write​(float x)
      Writes the 32-bit float to standard output.
      Parameters:
      x - the float to write.

    • write

      void write​(short x)
      Writes the 16-bit int to standard output.
      Parameters:
      x - the short to write.

    • write

      void write​(char x)
      Writes the 8-bit char to standard output.
      Parameters:
      x - the char to write.
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if x is not betwen 0 and 255.

    • write

      void write​(char x, int r)
      Writes the r-bit char to standard output.
      Parameters:
      x - the char to write.
      r - the number of relevant bits in the char.
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if r is not between 1 and 16.
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if x is not between 0 and 2r - 1.

    • write

      void write​(java.lang.String s)
      Writes the string of 8-bit characters to standard output.
      Parameters:
      s - the String to write.
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if any character in the string is not between 0 and 255.

    • write

      void write​(java.lang.String s, int r)
      Writes the string of r-bit characters to standard output.
      Parameters:
      s - the String to write.
      r - the number of relevants bits in each character.
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if r is not between 1 and 16.
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if any character in the string is not between 0 and 2r - 1.

    • write

      void write​(ISymbol sym)

    • writes

      void writes​(java.util.List<ISymbol> ls)
